# Cambridge International ExaminationsCambridge International General Certificate of Secondary Education  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 193, 201]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 214, 422, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[619, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 214, 902, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 170, 292]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 267, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 278, 904, 333]]<|/det|>
0625/33October/November 20181 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 415, 374]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper. No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 390, 386, 406]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 765, 560]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions. Electronic calculators may be used. You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 757, 600]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 73, 96, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 73, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 shows a large tank containing water. The tank leaks. Drops of water fall from the tank. The drops hit the ground at a regular rate.

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 390, 533, 408]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 422, 149, 440]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 422, 841, 440]]<|/det|>
A student measures the time interval between two drops of water hitting the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 438, 918, 470]]<|/det|>
